intro: Apalatoa amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian star vine, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are often heart-shaped and have a waxy surface, aiding in water retention in humid environments. Apalatoa amazonica plays a role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
